### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Variables specified by -OutVariable should contain only script output, not errors. Instead, when a command's output is not captured (e.g. by assigning to a variable, or piping to Out-Null or Format-*), both its output and ErrorRecords produced by errors are written to the OutVariable. When a command's output is captured, only the command's output is written to OutVariable, which is the correct behavior.

Example to reproduce:

```powershell
$ErrorActionPreference = 'Continue'
function Get-1Error2 {[CmdletBinding()]Param() 1; 1/0; 2}

Get-1Error2 -ov OutVariableOutputNotAssigned
$AssignedOutput = Get-1Error2 -ov OutVariableOutputAssigned
Get-1Error2 -ov OutVariableOutputToNull | Out-Null

[pscustomobject]@{
  OutVariableOutputNotAssigned = $OutVariableOutputNotAssigned
  AssignedOutput = $AssignedOutput
  OutVariableOutputAssigned = $OutVariableOutputAssigned
  OutVariableOutputToNull = $OutVariableOutputToNull
}
```

### Expected behavior

All "Output" variables should be identical (containing an array of the values 1 and 2.)

```
1
RuntimeException:
Line |
   3 |  function Get-1Error2 {[CmdletBinding()]Param() 1; 1/0; 2}
     |                                                    ~~~
     | Attempted to divide by zero.
2
RuntimeException:
Line |
   3 |  function Get-1Error2 {[CmdletBinding()]Param() 1; 1/0; 2}
     |                                                    ~~~
     | Attempted to divide by zero.
RuntimeException:
Line |
   3 |  function Get-1Error2 {[CmdletBinding()]Param() 1; 1/0; 2}
     |                                                    ~~~
     | Attempted to divide by zero.

OutVariableOutputNotAssigned AssignedOutput OutVariableOutputAssigned OutVariableOutputToNull
---------------------------- -------------- ------------------------- -----------------------
{1, 2}                       {1, 2}         {1, 2}                    {1, 2}
```

### Actual behavior

The error ("Attempted to divide by zero.") appears in the variable $OutVariableOutputNotAssigned instead of all "Output" variables being identical.

```
1
RuntimeException:
Line |
   3 |  function Get-1Error2 {[CmdletBinding()]Param() 1; 1/0; 2}
     |                                                    ~~~
     | Attempted to divide by zero.
2
RuntimeException:
Line |
   3 |  function Get-1Error2 {[CmdletBinding()]Param() 1; 1/0; 2}
     |                                                    ~~~
     | Attempted to divide by zero.
RuntimeException:
Line |
   3 |  function Get-1Error2 {[CmdletBinding()]Param() 1; 1/0; 2}
     |                                                    ~~~
     | Attempted to divide by zero.

OutVariableOutputNotAssigned         AssignedOutput OutVariableOutputAssigned OutVariableOutputToNull
----------------------------         -------------- ------------------------- -----------------------
{1, Attempted to divide by zero., 2} {1, 2}         {1, 2}                    {1, 2}
```

This error also appears in Windows PowerShell 5.1.
